SEARCH
Module test_ui1
Package test_ui.Components

Class VoteResultController

java.lang.Object
test_ui.Components.VoteResultController
public class VoteResultController extends Object
This class controls the voting result display. It is responsible for updating the user interface based on the results of the vote, displaying names of voters who voted yes or no, and managing actions related to the continue button.

  • Constructor Details

    • VoteResultController

      public VoteResultController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller class. This method is called after the FXML file has been loaded. It sets up necessary properties for elements such as text wrapping and alignment.

    • setup

      public void setup(boolean voteResult, String presidentName, ArrayList<String> yesVoteNames, ArrayList<String> noVoteNames)
      Sets up the voting results display.
      Parameters:
      voteResult - The result of the vote as a boolean; true indicates a successful election.
      presidentName - The name of the elected president, to be displayed if the election is successful.
      yesVoteNames - A list of names who voted 'yes' in the election.
      noVoteNames - A list of names who voted 'no' in the election.

    • getContinueButtonObservers

      public ActObserversAccess<Integer> getContinueButtonObservers()
      Provides access to observers of the continue button press event.
      Returns:
      An interface to manage observers of the continue button event.
